page.title: 08ATHLETICS
page.content: John MacKay of Clydebank Athletic Club has become the first Bankie to join the exclusive "Sub 4" Club thirty-one years after Sir Roger Bannister made history by becoming the first man to run a mile in under 4 minutes. Last Sunday John was timed at 3:57.6 as he finished in second place just half a second behind Adrian Callan.It was a great run by the young Faifley science teacher who finished ahead of internationalists John Laing (N.Ireland) and Dave Baptiste(England) both of whom also dipped under the 4 minute mark. John's immediate reward was an invitation to run against a top class field including the great Steve Ovett at the opening of Glasgow's new Crownpoint Track next week.
